item.title: Disassemble a Specific Function
item.author: shiny-labs@kylma.fr (shiny-labs)
item.description: Have you ever tried to disassemble only one function with objdump? Let’s take a tiny code which prints the result of an addition function: #include <stdio.h>#include <stdint.h> uint32_t add(uint32_t a, uint32_t b) { return a + b; } int main(int argc, char* argv[]) { uint32_t result = add(1300, 37); printf("result is %i\n", result); return 0; } Compile it and run it: $ gcc add.c -g -o add $ ./add result is 1337 Let’s now try to dump only one specific function, for example, add.
